task.summary: Default task
Initial commit.
Indent and line separator settings
Some Diamond source files that we will hopefully be able to compile at some point
Drop the prefix on the .dmd files because it might be confused with the compiler itself
Start on the lexer, it should identify comments correctly
Handle indentation, based on the implementation described in the Python documentation
Drop the "Token" suffix
Handle numeric literals
Better structure and documentation for InternalSyntaxException
A few keywords for now, mostly the ones in the test files I wrote
Handle keywords and identifiers in Lexer
Drop distinction between numeric literal types in the Diamond syntax and instead figure out which is referred to based on the value
Unnecessary statement
Process string literals
Identify "complex identifiers" like "Display.printLine" which contain multiple simple identifiers separated by a period
Add a number of punctuation tokens
Add a number of punctuation tokens
Create a Delimiter enum to avoid having many empty classes
Fix to the indentation implementation
Fix to the indentation implementation
Assignment is a delimiter, too, right?
Add basic operators
Add an entry point type method that generates a complete token stream from a compilation unit object
Restrict constructor visibility on classes that should only be constructed by the lexer
Generate equals() and hashCode() on token classes so that testing can work
Add a test against HelloWorld.dmd
Some changes to make the test run correctly
Fix a bug in the comment stripping method. If the beginning of the line was within a multi-line comment, no null character would be added, but it was attempting to drop it anyway
Null will work for the purpose of this variable if there is no real value
Indentation depth is 0 if the line is completely empty
I guess this is an edge case
More general case for this fix
Strip comments before figuring out the indentation mode, so that the indentation within comments doesn't get set as the mode
Much better comment stripping method
Much better comment stripping method
Minor bug in the indentation code
It'll probably only be compatible with Maven if it's done this way
Makes things easier for the test methods
Create and pass tests for the other two .dmd files
Use Deque in preference to the legacy Stack class
Makes more sense to pass the lexer a File directly, since compilation units are going to be nodes in the syntax tree and thus are at a different logical level of the compiler
SyntaxException is more general than just the lexer, so move it to the parent package; InternalSyntaxException is redundant if the line number is stored as an instance variable in Lexer
"*/" doesn't end a block comment if we're not already in one
This might not be good for performance
Handle escape sequences in string literals
Add a new test case for escape sequences, but it doesn't pass yet
Alright, so multi-line comments won't actually work, they can create situations with ambiguous indentation. Replace them with Python-style line comments starting with '#'
Got a bit carried away there, if there's no Unicode in the target infrastructure we can't really support Unicode at all
Got a bit carried away there, if there's no Unicode in the target infrastructure we can't really support Unicode at all
And since there is no Unicode, process all source code as ASCII
These aren't really the block delimiters, but it's definitely wrong to call them declaration delimiters
Root classes for the parse tree, maybe
Probably the easiest statement
Actually, the only root node type will probably subclass Node directly
Might be getting somewhere on type declarations, now
The old approach won't work, TypeDeclaration.name wouldn't yet be initialized when we enter Node.addChild
Method declarations, maybe
Better method declarations, and separate symbols from declarations
Expressions need to have a type
Create MethodSymbol as well, and make needed changes
Fix compilation error
Nodes for method invocation
I kind of like this syntax better
Add package statement
Get rid of native for now and deal with this later
Discard the idea of compound identifiers and replace them with the member access operator
Return statement, and have a null TypeSymbol represent void
Add VariableDeclaration
Create a new subpackage, it's getting cluttered and there need to be visitors as well
Can do the tricky Ruby-like syntax later, if at all
Add VariableReference and variable symbol resolution

option.name: LAST_COMMIT_MESSAGE
option.value: Add VariableReference and variable symbol resolution
